tags.name: Token Data
tags.description:
The Token Data endpoints provide detailed insights into tokens across the Solana ecosystem. These APIs let you:

- Retrieve rich token metadata (name, symbol, image, supply, socials, dev wallet, etc.)
- Access current market data such as price, market cap, liquidity, volume, transaction counts, and holders
- Analyze token performance with historical snapshots, time-window comparisons, and all-time high tracking
- Discover and search tokens by symbol, name, address, or trending activity

Together, these endpoints power dashboards, trading terminals, and research tools with structured, real-time token intelligence.

tags.name: Wallet Data
tags.description:
The Wallet Data endpoints expose portfolio-level intelligence for any Solana wallet. With these APIs you can:

- Query wallet holdings including balances, symbols, and percentage ownership
- Identify tokens deployed by a given wallet address (devWallet activity)
- Calculate realized and unrealized PnL (profit & loss) for specific tokens

This allows you to build wallet explorers, trading journals, and analytic surfaces that highlight on-chain activity and financial outcomes at the individual wallet level.

tags.name: Pair Data
tags.description:
The Pair Data endpoints combine token and liquidity pair analytics into a single view. These APIs let you:

- Retrieve detailed supply breakdowns for specific liquidity pairs
- Map pairs to their underlying tokens and associated developer wallets
- Analyze token distribution across bundlers, insiders, snipers, and LP burn addresses

This data helps you audit pair-level activity and understand how supply is allocated across different holder groups.

tags.name: MCP Server
tags.description:
The MCP Server endpoint delivers a Model Context Protocol (MCP) interface that connects token and wallet data directly into conversational AI workflows. It:

- Maps natural-language intents (e.g., *“show me the price of WIF”*) to underlying API operations
- Provides agentic access to Neglect’s APIs for LLMs, bots, and assistants
- Supports interactive exploration of token markets, wallet portfolios, and historical data without manual endpoint calls

This tag is designed for developers who want to integrate the Neglect API into AI agents, chat interfaces, and automation pipelines that rely on real-time on-chain intelligence.

get.description: Returns the metadata for a given token address stored in the database.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's address (e.g., a Solana address)

get.summary: Get Real-Time Market Data for a Token
get.description: Returns real-time metrics including price, market capitalization, FDV, liquidity, total and circulating supply, and current holder count. This endpoint does not use time windows and does not include trade statistics.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's mint address (e.g., a Solana SPL token address)

404.description: Token or its trading pairs not found

get.description: Returns ranked holder wallets, amounts, and percentage ownership for a given token address.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's mint address (e.g., Solana token address)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional limit on number of holders returned (default: 25, max: 100)

rank.description: Rank of the holder by token amount (1 = top holder)

walletAddress.description: Public key of the holder wallet

percentageOwned.description: Percentage of total token supply owned by the wallet

tokenSupply.description: Token amount held by the wallet (UI units)

get.description: Returns a list of trending tokens ordered by transaction count for a given interval.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Time interval window for counting transactions (default: 5m)

get.description: Performs a flexible search for tokens by name, symbol, or address, with optional filters, sorting, and symbol-only mode.

schema.description: Query text to search in name, symbol, or address

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return (1–25)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Field to sort results by

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort order direction

parameters.name: symbolOnly
parameters.description: If true, only searches the symbol field

get.description: Fetches the most recently graduated tokens, ordered by graduation time (descending).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return (1–100). Defaults to 25.

get.description: Returns the all-time-high (ATH) market cap and the timestamp when it occurred, based on all historical trades for the token.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's mint address (Solana SPL token).

ath.description: The highest market cap ever recorded for the token.

timestamp.description: ISO timestamp of when the ATH occurred, or null if no valid ATH exists.

404.description: No trades found for token, so ATH cannot be calculated

error.message: No trade data found for token

get.description: Returns a list of tokens where the specified wallet address is the developer (devWallet).

parameters.name: walletAddress
parameters.description: The wallet address of the deployer (devWallet)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tokens to return (default: 10, min: 1, max: 100)

200.description: List of tokens deployed by the wallet

post.description: Fetches historical price, market cap, or liquidity snapshots for a token across multiple time windows.

get.description: Fetches token metadata for a given pool (market) address.

parameters.name: poolAddress
parameters.description: The pool (market) address linked to the token

200.description: Token metadata for the given pool address

404.description: Token not found for the provided pool address

post.description: Returns percentage performance change for selected metrics over multiple time windows compared to the current value.

token.description: Token address to fetch performance data for

metrics.description: List of metrics to evaluate. Supported values: `price`, `mcap`, `liquidity`.

200.description: Performance data showing % change from current value across time windows.

get.description: Returns the latest price, market cap, and liquidity for a specific token address.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's contract address

404.description: Token or trade data not found

error.message: No trade data found for token

get.description: Retrieve the token holdings of a given wallet address, including balances and percentage ownership per token.

parameters.name: walletAddress
parameters.description: The wallet address to fetch holdings for

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tokens to return (default 10, max 100)

get.description: Calculate realized and unrealized profit and loss (PnL) for a wallet on a specific token.

parameters.name: walletAddress
parameters.description: The wallet address to calculate PnL for

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token contract address

200.description: PnL calculation for wallet and token

post.description: Returns the lowest and highest values of selected metrics (price, market cap, liquidity) within a specified time range for a token.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's contract address

metrics.description: Which metrics to return (price, mcap, liquidity)

mode.description: Behavior when requested range falls outside token lifespan

422.description: Requested range falls completely outside token lifespan (mode=error)

post.description: Provides the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for agentic, LLM-driven workflows. Enables conversational access to token and wallet data via intent-based mappings.

get.description: Returns audit data for a given token address, including developer, top holder, insider, bundler, sniper, and LP burn distributions.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: The token's address (e.g., a Solana mint address)

get.description: Returns 200 OK if the API service is healthy and responding.

Returns audit data for a single liquidity pair and its underlying token. Includes token-level distribution (developer, top holders, insiders, bundlers) and pair-level ownership breakdown (snipers, LP burn).

parameters.name: pairAddress
parameters.description: The pair address (e.g., liquidity pool address)

walletAddress.description: Developer wallet (pair.dev_wallet takes priority over token.dev_wallet)

tokenFound.description: Whether token metadata/audit row was present

get.description:
Returns audit data for multiple tokens in a single batch call. Accepts up to 10 token addresses via a comma-separated `addresses` query parameter. Each entry includes developer, top holder, insider, bundler, sniper, and LP burn distributions.

**Cost:** 10 credits per request.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of up to 10 token mint addresses

200.description: Batch token audit data returned successfully

error.message: A maximum of 10 addresses may be provided

get.description:
Returns audit data for multiple liquidity pairs in a single batch call. Accepts up to 10 pair addresses via the `addresses` query parameter. Each entry includes pair-level and token-level audit details including developer, top holders, insiders, bundlers, snipers, and LP burn distribution.

**Cost:** 10 credits per request.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of up to 10 pair addresses

200.description: Batch pair audit data returned successfully

tokenAddress.description: Token mint address associated with the pair

tokenSupply.description: Total token supply from the token record

walletAddress.description: Developer wallet (pair.dev_wallet takes priority over token.dev_wallet)

value.error: A maximum of 10 addresses may be provided
